statement: Tumors expressing TSC1 or TSC2 mutations show notably more sensitivity to everolimus than their wild-type counterparts.
Tumors expressing TSC1 or TSC2 mutations show notably more sensitivity to everolimus than their wild-type counterparts.

A patient with metastatic bladder cancer that responded well to the mTOR inhibitor everolimus was shown to harbor a TSC1 frameshift truncation mutation (c.1907_1908del, p.Glu636fs) and a nonsense NF2 mutation. 2/3 additional patients with TSC1 mutations also had mild responses to everolimus.

Following rapamycin treatment of mice with KrasG12D-induced lung tumors, mice with Tsc1 deletion (exon17/18 deletion resulting in frameshift) in the lung exhibit increased overall survival, increased apoptosis, reduced proliferation and reduced tumor burden compared to Tsc1 wildtype mice.
Cells with PTEN deficiency have been shown to exhibit slowed growth in reponse to PI3K-mTOR inhibitors.
citation: Courtney et al., 2010, J. Clin. Oncol.

statement: PTEN nonsense  , including R233*, has been shown to be inactivating and loss-of-function, but do not have prognostic value in glioblastoma multiforme patients.
Patients with other BRAF V600 mutations also respond well to the V600E drug dabrafenib.

statement: Patients with other BRAF V600 mutations also respond well to the V600E drug dabrafenib.

statement: Complete remission rates were higher and event-free survival was longer for normal karyotype AML patients with Exon 12 NPM1  .
NPM1 mutations were not associated with M2 FAB subtypes
NPM1 mutations were associated with M4, M5a and M5b FAB subtypes
NPM1 mutation without FLT3-ITD was associated with reduced relapse risk and increased overall survival in young adult AML patients (median age 43)

Younger (16-60), normal karyotype AML patients with Exon 12 NPM1 mutation and without FLT3-ITD have increased overall survival, relapse-free survival and response to induction chemotherapy

statement: NPM1 mutation was associated with higher complete remission rates, lower cumulative incidence of relapse and higher overall survival in intermediate risk AML patients

A head-to-tail in-frame fusion between exon1 of DNAJB1 and exon2 of PRKACA resulting from an ~400kb deletion was observed in 100% (15/15) fibrolamellar hepatocellular carcinomas examined. The fusion was confirmed at both RNA and DNA level in all primary and metastatic tumor samples but not in adjacent normal tissue. Immunoprecipitation and Western blot analyses confirmed that the chimeric protein is expressed in tumor tissue, and a cell culture assay indicated that it retains kinase activity.

A head-to-tail in-frame fusion between exon1 of DNAJB1 and exon2 of PRKACA resulting from an ~400kb deletion was observed in 100% (15/15) fibrolamellar hepatocellular carcinomas examined. The fusion was confirmed at both RNA and DNA level in all primary and metastatic tumor samples but not in adjacent normal tissue. Immunoprecipitation and Western blot analyses confirmed that the chimeric protein is expressed in tumor tissue, and a cell culture assay indicated that it retains kinase activity.

statement: Cell lines expressing the BRAF V600E mutation responded better to vemurafenib treatment than cells wildtype for BRAF as measured by reduced cellular proliferation and inhibition of MET and ERK phosphorylation
Cyclin D1 overexpression is associated with the ER-positive subtype of breast cancer.
citation: Arnold et al., 2005, J. Clin. Oncol.

statement: In ER-positive breast cancer patients, Cyclin D1 overexpression is associated with shorter overall survival and increased metastasis.
citation: Arnold et al., 2005, J. Clin. Oncol.

statement: Cyclin D1 overexpression is associated with shorter overall survival and increased metastasis in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
citation: Thomas et al., 2005, Int J Exp Pathol

statement: Cyclin D1 overexpression is associated with shorter overall survival and increased metastasis in mantle cell lymphoma.
citation: Jares et al., 2007, Nat. Rev. Cancer

statement: Inceased copy number of CCND1 is associated with poorer overall survival.
Three studies have associated CCND1 expression with poorer survival.
Three studies have found no significant survival impact for CCND1 in lung cancer.
Trametinib can inhibit ARF-mediated ERK phosphorylation and soft agar colony formation of AALE cells in vitro
citation: Imielinski et al., 2014, J. Clin. Invest.

statement: Sorafenib can inhibit ARF-mediated MEK phosphorylation and soft agar colony formation of AALE cells in vitro
citation: Imielinski et al., 2014, J. Clin. Invest.

statement: In one patient with S214C mutation, the use of sorafenib has led to more than 5 years of survival and near remission.
citation: Imielinski et al., 2014, J. Clin. Invest.

statement: SH-SY5Y and Kelly cells with mutant ALK (F1174L) and Ba/F3 cells overexpressing ALK harboring the F1174L mutation are sensitive to TAE684-mediated growth inhibition
CH5424802 is effective in inhibiting the activity of the F1174L ALK mutant in a kinase activity assay and proliferation assay using neuroblastoma KELLY cells.
CH5424802 treatment resulted in significant tumor regression in xenograft models produced from Ba/F3 cells expressing EML4-ALK or AML4-ALK with the L1196M mutation

TAE684 inhibits growth of Ba/F3 cells expressing ALK with the R1275Q mutation at a higher IC50 than those expressing F1174L and the SMS-KCNR cell line harboring the R1275Q mutation was resistant to TAE684
Ba/F3 cells expressing the RANBP2-ALK fusion containing an F1174L mutation were more resistant to crizotinib treatment than Ba/F3 cells expressing RANBP2-ALK without this mutation.
Cells lines expressing ALK harboring the F1174L mutation are less sensitive to growth inhibition by crizotinib than cells expressing the R1275Q mutation.
citation: Bresler et al., 2011, Sci Transl Med

statement: High levels of crizotinib can overcome drug resistance of Ba/F3 cells expressing the EML4-ALK fusion containing the F1174L mutation.
citation: Heuckmann et al., 2011, Clin. Cancer Res.

statement: PIK3CA mutation, but not AKT1 E17K, has been shown to confer sensitiity to the AKT inhibitor MK-2206 in breast cancer cell lines.
citation: Beaver et al., 2013, Clin. Cancer Res.

statement: Treatment of Philadelphia Chromosome positive leukemias with Arsenic Trioxide results in high rates of complete remission in patients.
The clinical use of imatinib in patients with BCR-ABL fusion has drastic sensitivity to the drug.
BCR-ABL inhibitors such as imatinib have lead to "significantly improved prognosis, response rate, overall survival, and patient outcome in CML patients compared to previous therapeutic regimens."
The use of second-generation BCR-ABL targeted therapies has shown signifcantly greater response in patients resistant to imatinib.
The use of second-generation BCR-ABL targeted therapies has shown signifcantly greater response in patients resistant to imatinib.
The presence of BCR-ABL fusion is considered the characterizing feature of chronic myeloid leukemia, and has been widely thought of as the initiating event in the disease.
BCR-ABL fusions have been found to contribute to imatinib resistance in AML cell lines.

Data from deep sequencing of a Ph-negative clone of a Ph-positive CML patient has found a driving mutation in DNMT3A that preceeded the BCR-ABL fusion, and may imply the possibility that BCR-ABL is not universally the initiating event in CML.
